text:
Hi everyone, I'm the lead maintainer for the <http://HubSpot.NET|HubSpot.NET> .NET SDK for the API. I wanted to let everyone know that we used to be on GitHub at `squaredup/HubSpot.NET` but recently made a dedicated organization and moved the repo to `HubSpot-net/HubSpot.NET`.

We'd love the help in working toward a solid 1.0 release if anyone is interested in contributing!
<@U22PKFRU5> this would be good to add to the open source page of the code gallery

yassss - good call <@U7SL518D6>!!

<@UJXGNH1H9> - Could we please add it to:  <https://designers.HubSpot.com/open-source> ??? :slightly_smiling_face:

If so, please click the "Submit Your Project" button, tell us a little more, and we'll add it. :slightly_smiling_face: :raised_hands:
Oh yes, definitely! I will add it!
LMK if you have any issues submitting <@UJXGNH1H9>. Once submitted, I'll need 2-3 days to add it in. :slightly_smiling_face:
I'm not sure I understand the `CMS Developer Community - Slack Channel` field. How do I need to respond to that?

Do you want us to create a slack channel for collaboration :slightly_smiling_face: ?

(see <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> for an example).
Ah I see. Well, we do have a public slack workspace available already.

ah cool! ... If you want, just add the link where folks can sign up for that one.

If not, just write N/A in the form field.
Okay, great. That clears it up! Thank you
I can see how that form field is confusing. #BadUX  I'll update for the future.
haha it's all good. Thanks for helping me this time
thank YOU for helping lead that project! ... love seeing open source stuff (especially around HubSpot). :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi folks,
I’m adding a form to landing pages using the Ajax API and I can’t seem to get it to track submissions properly. See attached image.

Hey <@U26DA9CQ0> this isn’t documented but you can add the page id (found in the URL as you are editing the page) to the `context` field of your JSON you are sending to HubSpot as `pageId` and put the Id as a string it should work.  Again this isn’t documented so it might stop working at some point but for now that does work
